Package name.martingeisse.grumpyjson

package name.martingeisse.grumpyjson

    name.martingeisse.grumpyjson.util
     
  • Class
    Description
    ExceptionMessages
    This class is mostly useful for unit tests, so we don't have to check for exceptions while working around unknown error messages -- this way we just know these messages.
    FieldErrorNode
    This class typically gets constructed by grumpyjson and consumed by grumpyrest, without any need for the application code to deal with it.
    FieldErrorNode.Field
    A node that specifies a single field nesting level for its subtree.
    FieldErrorNode.FlattenedError
    This structure represents a single error, i.e.
    FieldErrorNode.InternalException
    A leaf node with an internal exception.
    FieldErrorNode.Message
    A leaf node with an error message.
    FieldErrorNode.Siblings
    A node that groups two subtrees together to allow the tree to store multiple errors.
    JsonEngine
    This class is the main entry point into the JSON conversion system.
    JsonGenerationException
    This exception type gets thrown when the state of the objects being serialized is not possible to map to JSON.
    JsonRegistry
    This registry keeps the JsonTypeAdapters used by a JsonEngine.
    JsonTypeAdapter<T>
    Defines the conversion from and to JSON for a single type.
    JsonValidationException
    This exception type gets thrown when the incoming JSON does not match the expected structure.
    RecordAdapter<T>
    A RecordAdapter is build for the raw type (class) of a record, so a single RecordAdapter handles all parameterized types for that raw type.
    RecordInfo
    NOT PUBLIC API
